title: Feature story
text:
A feature story is a piece of <a href="non-fiction">non-fiction</a> writing about <a href="news">news</a>. A feature story is a type of <a href="soft%20news">soft news</a>. The main sub-types are the "news feature" and the "<a href="Human%20interest%20story">human-interest story</a>".
A feature story is distinguished from other types of non-news by the quality of the writing. Stories should be memorable for their reporting, crafting, creativity, and economy of expression.
Style.
A feature story, as contrasted with straight news reporting, normally presents newsworthy events and information through a narrative story, complete with a <a href="Plot%20%28narrative%29">plot</a> and story characters. It differs from a <a href="short%20story">short story</a> primarily in that the content is not <a href="fiction">fiction</a>al. Like literature, the feature story relies upon creativity and subjectivity to make an emotional connection with the readers and may highlight some universal aspect of <a href="human%20nature">human nature</a>. Unlike straight news, the feature story serves the purpose of entertaining the readers, in addition to informing them. Although truthful and based on good facts, they are less objective than straight news.
Unlike straight news, the subject of a feature story is usually <a href="Evergreen%20%28journalism%29">not time sensitive</a>. It generally features good news.
Feature stories are usually written in an active style, with an emphasis on lively, entertaining prose. Some forms, such as a "color story", uses <a href="description">description</a> as the main mode.
Published features and news.
Feature stories are stories with only one feature, but are creative and true. While the distinction between published features and news is often clear, when approached conceptually there are few hard boundaries between the two. It is quite possible to write a feature story in the style of a news story. Nevertheless, features do tend to take a more narrative approach, perhaps using opening paragraphs as scene-setting <a href="narrative%20hook">narrative hook</a>s instead of the delivery of the most important facts. A feature story can be in a news article, a newspaper, and even online.

A profile presents information about a person, but it differs from a <a href="biography">biography</a> by focusing on the person's personality or anecdotes, rather than the factual data about birth, education, or major achievements.
